conclusion: To determine if objects A and B have the same velocity at time t1, analyze the acceleration-time graph.

The graph shows acceleration on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Object B has constant acceleration, represented by the straight line from the origin to point B. Object A has zero acceleration after time t1, indicated by the horizontal line at point A.
The acceleration of object B is constant and can be represented as a_B. The slope of line OB gives the constant acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = t1, object A accelerates at the same rate as object B. After t = t1, object A has zero acceleration.
Velocity is the integral of acceleration with respect to time. For object B, the velocity at time t1 is v_B(t1) = a_B * t1.
For object A, the velocity at time t1 is v_A(t1) = a_B * t1.
At time t1, both objects have been accelerating at the same rate a_B for the same duration t1. Therefore, their velocities at t1 are equal: v_A(t1) = v_B(t1) = a_B * t1.
At time t1, objects A and B have the same velocity.
Final Answer: Yes, at time t1, the two objects have the same velocity.
